line_item.description: Demolish existing 300A main breaker in main disconnect
line_item.specifications: Existing 300A, 3-pole main breaker to be replaced with new 400A breaker
line_item.notes: Implied by Oneline Note 2 on sheet E4.0 which requires replacement.

line_item.specifications: Zurn Z100 Series 15" diameter roof drain with cast iron body, underdeck clamp, and cast iron dome.
line_item.notes: Quantity and type from Plumbing Fixture Schedule. Locations shown on A1.2 and M2.2.

line_item.specifications: Zurn Z100 Series 15" diameter roof drain with cast iron body, underdeck clamp, cast iron dome, and 2" water dam.
line_item.notes: Quantity and type from Plumbing Fixture Schedule. Locations shown on A1.2 and M2.2.

updates.specifications: RTU-1, RTU-2, RTU-3, RTU-4, RTU-5, RTU-6
updates.notes: Demolish all 6 RTUs, roof curbs, and all associated appurtenances per Note 1 on M1.2. Electrical drawings use 'MAU' designation for some of these units.
Depth is 3.5' per callout on C1.0. Sized for 10 year 24 hour storm. Roof drain area #1 = 14,500 SF.
Depth is 3.5' per callout on C1.0. Sized for 10 year 24 hour storm. Roof drain area #2 = 1,500 SF.

updates.specifications: 6" minimum trench width. Bed pipe with Class E bedding. Backfill trench with in situ fill. Provide 4" thick 'Insulfoam 40' board 6" to 1' above pipe. Provide 6" wide vinyl warning tape 18" above pipe.
updates.notes: Per typical rain leader trench detail D/C3.0.

updates.specifications: 4" concrete sidewalk w/W1.4xW1.4 WWM. 3,000 psi concrete. 8" thickened edge with #3 rebar continuous. Slope per plan. 1/2" radius at edge. 2" leveling course.
updates.notes: Per typical concrete sidewalk detail B/C3.0. Added thickened edge detail.

updates.description: Demo roofing, sheathing, and sleepers at Roof D
updates.notes: Key note K on A1.0 points to Roof D, not Roof B. Provide new roof sheathing and tapered insulation per spec. See detail 10/A2.3.

updates.description: Roof Type R1 with Recovery Board
updates.specifications: EPDM fully adhered roofing membrane over 5/8" Georgia Pacific Dens Deck Recovery Board. Install over existing 1/2" sheathing. Existing trusses to remain.
updates.notes: Addendum No. 2 requires installation of a 5/8" recovery board throughout all R1 areas to meet 20 year / 120mph warranty requirements. This is a critical scope addition.
ADDITIVE ALTERNATE #1. Provide with low-leakage economizer, power exhaust with BPC, CO2 sensor, 24" factory roof curb, smoke detector in return, gravity relief. See notes 1-6 on M0.1

Field fabricated. Detail 2/M2.3 shows exterior dimensions 32"x32"x24"H, but a note calls for interior dimensions of 24"x24"x32"H. This is a conflict; detail drawing dimensions should govern. Coordinate with roofing and architect.

new_packages.name: Electrical - Power Distribution and New Circuits
new_packages.description: Upgrades to main power distribution and installation of new panels and branch circuits for all new mechanical equipment.

confidence.reasoning: This scope was entirely missed by the initial extraction but is clearly detailed on sheets E1.0, E3.0, E4.0, and E5.0.

line_items.description: Replace main breaker in Main Disconnect
line_items.specifications: Replace existing 300A main breaker with new 400A main breaker.
225A MLO, 208Y/120V, 3P, 4W panelboard. See schedule on E5.0.
New panel to replace demolished Panel 'X'.
line_items.notes: Per Note 2 on E1.0. Move all existing circuits from Panel 'X' to Panel 'D'.

line_items.specifications: Install new circuits from Panel 'MECH' to new RTUs per Roof Power Plan E3.0 and Panel Schedule E5.0.
line_items.notes: Includes circuits for RTU-1 through RTU-6 with specified conduit and wire sizes.

line_items.description: New branch circuits for Exhaust Fans
line_items.specifications: Install new circuits for EF-1, EF-2, EF-3 (from Panel D) and EF-4, EF-5 (from Panel MECH).
line_items.notes: Per power plans E1.0, E3.0 and panel schedules.

line_items.description: New branch circuits for Heat Trace
line_items.specifications: Install circuits for heat trace on rain leaders and overflow leaders.
line_items.notes: Per detail 2/E4.0 and Note 3 on E3.0. Coordinate with Civil and Mechanical.

new_packages.name: Mechanical - Gas Piping Systems
new_packages.description: New natural gas piping from existing meter manifold to all new RTU units, including supports and testing.

confidence.reasoning: This scope was entirely missed by the initial extraction but is clearly detailed on sheet M2.3.

line_items.specifications: Black steel pipe, ASTM A53. Sizes: RTU-1 (3/4"), RTU-2 (1"), RTU-3 (1-1/4"), RTU-4 (1-1/4"), RTU-5 (1-1/2"), RTU-6 (2").
line_items.notes: Run from existing gas meter manifold. Includes all fittings, valves, and supports per M2.3.

new_packages.name: Building Automation and Controls
new_packages.description: Standalone controls for new HVAC equipment, including factory controls, timers, and sensors.

confidence.reasoning: This scope was missed by the initial extraction. Addendum No. 1 provides a critical clarification, simplifying the scope from a DDC system to standalone controls.

line_items.specifications: All equipment to be controlled by factory controls, wall mounted timer switches, or a time clock.
line_items.notes: Per Addendum No. 1, a central DDC system is NOT required. Scope includes VFDs, economizer controls, CO2 sensors, and smoke detectors as scheduled on M0.1.

new_packages.name: Testing, Adjusting and Balancing
new_packages.description: Independent air balancing of the complete heating and HVAC systems per SMACNA standards.

confidence.reasoning: This scope was missed by the initial extraction but is explicitly required in the specifications on sheet M0.2.

line_items.specifications: Perform air balancing per SMACNA Balancing and Adjustment Manual. Adjust air quantities to within 5% of design values.
line_items.notes: Submit final TAB report before project is complete.

new_packages.name: Commissioning and Startup
new_packages.description: Startup and functional verification of all new mechanical and electrical equipment.

confidence.reasoning: This scope was missed by the initial extraction but is required in the specifications on sheet M0.2.

line_items.specifications: Provide startup of all listed installed equipment. Verify equipment meets design intent for airflow, temperature, etc.

gaps_identified: The initial extraction completely missed the new electrical power distribution scope, including main breaker/feeder upgrades and new panel installations.
The new gas piping scope from the meter to the new RTUs was not extracted as a separate package.
The building controls scope was not extracted. A critical clarification in Addendum No. 1, which simplifies this scope, was also missed.
The requirement for an independent Testing, Adjusting, and Balancing (TAB) contractor was not extracted.
The requirement for equipment startup and commissioning was not extracted.
A critical, cost-impacting requirement from Addendum No. 2 for a 5/8" roofing recovery board was missed.

ai_observations.observation: The model failed to extract several complete and critical work packages, including all new electrical work, gas piping, controls, TAB, and commissioning. This indicates a major failure in identifying scope from specification documents and integrating information from multiple drawing types.

The model did not process or incorporate critical information from the addenda, specifically the change in controls philosophy (Addendum 1) and the addition of the roofing recovery board (Addendum 2). This is a significant flaw as addenda often contain high-impact changes.

The model was confused by inconsistent equipment naming between disciplines (e.g., 'RTU' on mechanical drawings vs. 'MAU' on electrical drawings), leading to an incorrect quantity for the RTU demolition line item.
Minor errors were made in transcribing dimensional data from the drawings, such as the depth of the drain fields.

On a positive note, for the packages it did create (Demolition, Civil, Roofing, Mechanical Equipment), the model did a good job of extracting detailed line items from plans, schedules, and detail sheets, demonstrating a good ability to parse graphical information.

overall_assessment.summary: The initial AI extraction is severely incomplete and unreliable for bidding purposes. While it successfully identified and detailed several key packages (Demolition, Civil, Roofing, RTUs), it completely missed the entire new electrical distribution, gas piping, controls, TAB, and commissioning scopes. Furthermore, it failed to incorporate critical, cost-impacting changes from the project addenda, such as the requirement for a roofing recovery board and the simplification of the controls system. The data that was extracted contained minor inaccuracies and showed confusion with inconsistent terminology across disciplines. The missing scopes and addenda items introduce significant financial and execution risk. The extraction requires major additions and corrections to be considered usable.
